glosses: to knit; to darn; to braid, plait
to weave (using reeds, canes, osiers, wire)
to build (a wall); to lay, bond (bricks or stones)
to establish, to create, to bring into being

etymology:
Inherited from Ottoman Turkish اورمك (örmek), from Proto-Turkic *ȫr- (“to plait”).
Cognate with Old Turkic [script needed] (ör-, “to plait, build”), Azerbaijani hörmək (“to plait”), Bashkir үреү (ürew, “to plait”), Khakas ӱрерге (ürerge, “to plait”), Kyrgyz өрүү (örüü, “to braid”), Turkmen örmek (“to knit, braid”), Uzbek oʻrmoq (“to weave”), Yakut өр (ör, “to knit”).
